main.noDevices: Plug in a SteelSeries device to get started
main.hideDevice: Are you sure you want to hide DEVICE_NAME?
main.fwUpdateBadge: CRITICAL UPDATE: Click to install new firmware.

library.addApplicationDescription: Automatikusan megváltozathatja a beállításokat az eszközén amikor alkalmazások között vált.
library.addApplicationClickme: Click here to try it out now!
library.addAnother: Click here to link an application to a configuration
library.deleteModalText: Are you sure you want to delete application APPLICATION_NAME?
library.allDevicesSelected: All devices for this application have been selected

language.restart: Kérjük indítsa újra a SteelSeries Engine-t a nyelvi beállítások változtatásához.

optimize.notice: SteelSeries Engine can optimize your listening experience based on what you have connected to the SteelSeries Soundcard.

update.instruction: Click Update to download the latest update from steelseries.com

downloadNotification.title: Update Download Available
downloadNotification.text: SteelSeries Engine #VERSION# available.  Click to begin download.

installNotification.title: Update Install Available
installNotification.text: SteelSeries Engine #VERSION# downloaded.  Click to install.

downloadFailureNotification.title: Update Download Failed
downloadFailureNotification.text1: SteelSeries Engine #VERSION# download has failed. Click to reattempt.
downloadFailureNotification.text2: SteelSeries Engine #VERSION# download has failed. Please try again later.

verificationFailureNotification.title: Update Verification Failed
verificationFailureNotification.text1: SteelSeries Engine #VERSION# verification has failed. Click to download it again.
verificationFailureNotification.text2: SteelSeries Engine #VERSION# verification has failed. Please try again later.

downloadFailureDialogMessage.text1: The update download has been interrupted. Please try again.
downloadFailureDialogMessage.text2: The update download has been interrupted. Please try again later.

verificationFailureDialogMessage.text1: Update could not be verified. Please try again.
verificationFailureDialogMessage.text2: Update could not be verified. Please try again later.

main.firmwareUpdateText: During firmware installation, do not unplug your device, turn off your computer or exit the software. This may result in the device becoming unusable.
main.firmwareUpdateBootloaderModeTextLine1: The last firmware update for your #DEVICE_NAME# failed.  Your device will be unusable until you run the updater again. Click Start to begin.
main.firmwareUpdateBootloaderModeTextLine2: If you do not want to run the update now, please unplug your device.
main.firmwareUpdateComplete: Update complete. Please disconnect and reconnect your device to finish the process.
main.firmwareUpdateFailure: An error occurred that prevented the successful completion of the firmware update.

preferences.title: Preferences
preferences.syncFailureMessage: An error occurred that has prevented the completion of the most recent backup.
preferences.syncTroubleshootMessage: Click here to get troubleshooting tips.
preferences.accountLinkExplanation: Click the link to visit your SteelSeries account page on the web.
preferences.autoSyncExplanation: Auto Sync will automatically back up your data to the cloud when changes are made.

main.nextDeviceFirmwareUpdateText: Plug the #DEVICE_NAME# into your computer with the USB cable to perform the update

cloudIntro.summary: Bring your configurations and macros with you wherever you game.
cloudIntro.description: Back up your data to cloud storage and sync between computers automatically.
cloudIntro.instructions: Log in with your SteelSeries ID to access SteelSeries CloudSync features.

main.firmwareUpdateAdditionalTextMouseBase: If you cannot update your base now, press Update Later. You will be asked to update it next time you connect the base.
main.firmwareUpdateRePairDevice2: 2. Disconnect the cable from the mouse
main.firmwareUpdateRePairDevice3: 3. Plug the cable into the base
main.firmwareUpdateRePairDevice5: 5. Press the connect button on the base until the ring flashes
main.firmwareUpdateRePairDevice6: 6. Press the connect button on the mouse until it changes color

cloud.usernameHelpTooltip: Log in with the same email and password that you used to register for a SteelSeries ID on the SteelSeries website. If you do not have a SteelSeries ID,register first and then log in here to access CloudSync features.
cloud.logInCallout: Click the cloud icon to log in to CloudSync.

theme.firstNotice: You have connected a DEVICE_NAME for the first time.  Which one are you using?
theme.subsequentNotice: Choose the DEVICE_NAME you are using

main.sentryUpdateBadge: CRITICAL UPDATE: Click to install Sentry software suite.
main.firmwareUpdateConnectUSB: Open the panel on the back of the controller and remove the batteries. Use the port inside to connect the controller to your computer using a Micro USB cable.
main.firmwareUpdateRePairBluetooth: The new firmware was successfully installed. To complete the update, you must unplug the controller and replace the batteries. Then, open the Bluetooth Menu. Select the controller from the list of Bluetooth devices, and then press the Remove button. Finally, re-pair the controller.

gameSense.splash1: Your SteelSeries devices now respond to your games in real time with our latest feature.
gameSense.details5: See a full list of all devices supported by GameSense.
gameSense.details7: Support GameSense in your game. Learn how.

csgo.headline: GameSense and CS:GO
csgo.autoStart: GameSense will automatically start at the beginning of a match

minecraft.headline: GameSense and Minecraft
minecraft.modDl: Download and install the GameSense Minecraft Mod
minecraft.autoStart: GameSense will automatically start when your Minecraft world loads

general.supported: Plug in one of these supported devices
general.proTip: Tip: GameSense will work as long as SteelSeries Engine 3 is running in the background.

gameSense.checkOut: Click here to customize your GameSense settings.

app.description: Használja a SteelSeries hardverét a #GAME_NAME# információinak megjelenítésére.

discord.description: Jelenítsen meg egyéni effekteket az eszközén a Dicord éseményektől függően. Értesítések, felhasználó csatlakozása, némítás és még sok egyéb.
discord.download: Töltse le a Discordot, hogy belekezdjen

audiovisualizer.description: Nézze eszközét, miközben zenét hallgat. A támogatott Prism eszközök képesek a dinamikus hanghatások megjelenítésére.

main.externalSoftwareBadge: CRITICAL UPDATE: Additional software for this device is required. Click here to install.

qsg.firstPair: If this is the first time you have paired the controller to your PC, you will need to reconnect the controller to enable full XInput functionality. Please turn the controller off, wait 2 seconds, then turn it on. It will now pair and XInput will be enabled

myDevices.label: My Devices
myDevices.listHeader: Below is a list of all of your activated SteelSeries devices.

errors.alreadyOwned: Error: This product is already activated for your account

myDevices.notSeeingProduct: Nem látja a termékét?  Try activating it and/or clicking the 'Refresh' button above.

backgroundInstall.installFailed: An error occurred. Please try again later.

connectDevice.pleaseConnect: Please Connect A SteelSeries Engine enabled device.
connectDevice.notSeeing: Nem látja eszközét? Miként van csatlakoztatva?

signup.heading: Először van itt?
signup.listItem1: Szinkronizálni beállításait több számítógépen keresztül a CloudSync-et használva.
signup.listItem2: Szoftver lehetőségeket aktiválni az Arctis 3 headsetéhez.
signup.listItem4: Támogatás elérése technikai hibákhoz vagy kérdésekhez.

main.firmwareUpdateRequiredForArctis7: Your Arctis 7 needs to be firmware updated before it can be configured.  Please connect the device then click the Firmware Update button below to begin.
main.externalSoftwareBadgeWithoutInstall: Additional software for this device is required.

prismSync.title: PrismSync

tooltips.devices: PrismSync displays illumination effects across your devices. To start, enable the devices youwant the effects to use PrismSync. Enabled devices will override your current illumination settings only.Other Engine Apps, such as gamesense take precedent over PrismSync unless they are disabled.
tooltips.inactiveMode: When enabled, Sleep Mode will turn off all illumination and effects on your PrismSync devices when your display goes to sleep. When disabled, the illumination effects will continue running.
tooltips.templates: Templates are predefined lighting patterns will which apply to all devices for which PrismSync is enabled

prismSync.description: Világítások és effektek amelyek and effects that átszállnak a SteelSeries eszközeiden.

engineApps.title: Alkalmazások
engineApps.author: készítette: #AUTHOR#
engineApps.description: Alkalmazások, amelyek kapcsolódhatnak a SteelSeries eszközökhöz.

demo.title: Készítse el saját alkalmazását
demo.description: Látogassa meg a Techblogunkat, hogy megtanulja miképpen készítheti el saját alkalmazását a SteelSeries Engine-hoz.

imageSync.title: ImageSync
imageSync.description: Konvertáljon egy animált GIF-et villágítási effekté a billentyűzetén. A végleges animáció mérete 22 x 6px.
imageSync.imageToolsTooltip: Adjust your image to best fit your keyboard. Adjusting brightness and contrast may help improve the illumination effect of some images. Use the crop tool to change the size of your image. To set a background color for areas your image doesn't cover, use the background color tool.
imageSync.displayTooltip: Import a GIF to get started. It will be displayed in the editor, allowing you to edit it before applying it to your keyboard. To start over, use the "New Import" button. To export your GIF to share, use the "Export" button. To display the GIF on your keyboard and save it in your history, use the "Save" button.
imageSync.myGifsTooltip: This is a history of images you've created in the past that can be reused. To use a previous image, click on it, to see the animation in the frame, simply hover over the image.
imageSync.presetsTooltip: Here's a curated collection of our favorite GIFs for you to get started with.

windowsCPI.mouseAccelerationExplanation: A Windows mutató beállítások problémákat okozhatnak a natív egere irányításakor. Javasoljuk az Javított mutató pontosságának beállítását kikapcsolni és a sebességét alapon hagyani (nincs szorzó.)
windowsCPI.configWindowWarning: Your mouse settings are being affected by Windows Pointer Options.
windowsCPI.clickToFixCPI: Kattintson ide, hogy kijavítsuk a beállításokat.

deviceConfig.modalText: Are you sure you want to delete configuration PROFILE_NAME?
deviceConfig.modalRevertConfigText: A változások nem lettek mentve. Elveti a változásokat?
deviceConfig.modalSaveImmutableText: This configuration cannot be overwritten. Would you like to save this as a new configuration?

errors.configNameTaken: This configuration name is not available

deviceConfig.missingLeftClickBindingWarning: Removing the Button 1 action will make your mouse unusable.  Are you sure you want to do this?

launchApplication.title: Launch Application
launchApplication.deleteBindingWarning: If you remove this app, all buttons with this binding will be reset to their default binding.  Are you sure you want to continue?

tooltips.playOnce: The action will play one time.
tooltips.repeatNTimes: The action will repeat a set number of times.
tooltips.toggleRepeat: Press once to start automatically repeating the action, and press it again to stop.
tooltips.toggleHold: Press the button once to start playing the action continuously, and press it again to stop.
tooltips.repeatWhilePressed: Press and hold the button to automatically repeat an action.
tooltips.triggerDirection: Choose whether the action will trigger when the key is pressed or released

liveRecord.title: New Macro Created
liveRecord.messageOne: A new macro has been created from a live recording with the name "#MACRO_NAME#"
liveRecord.messageMultiple: #NUM_MACROS# new macros have been created from live recordings with the following names:

deviceConfig.minesweeperGameModal: Use the Keypad 1, 2, or 3 keys to select a difficulty, and press the lit keys to reveal keys. The number of times keys flash reveal how many mines are touching that key. Escape toggles flagging mode.
deviceConfig.lightsOutGameModal: Use the Keypad Enter key to start the game, and use the keypad number keys to try to turn off all the lights.
deviceConfig.snakeGameModal: Use the Keypad Enter key to start the game, and use the arrow keys to control your snake.

onboardProfiles.tooltip:
On-board profiles store nearly all the settings you apply to a configuration in Engine, including button bindings, macros and illumination settings.

Drag and drop to import or export settings from the mouse.

#DEVICE_SPECIFIC_TOOLTIP#

The first on-board profile cannot be overwritten. This profile is designated for Engine use.
onboardProfiles.plugIn: Plug in #DEVICENAME# to see On-Board Profiles

firstTimeImport.promptMessage: We see this is the first time you have plugged in your device. Would you like to import the on-board profiles into Engine as configurations?

onboardProfiles.overwriteWarning: This will overwrite this on-board profile, and the original profile will be lost to the void.

modal1.title: What are on-board profiles?
modal1.text: These are configurations that are saved on your mouse, and you can use them even without Engine running.

modal2.title: Copy configurations to your mouse
modal2.text: Click on a configuration and drag it to one of the on-board profiles.

modal3.title: Copy on-board profiles to configurations
modal3.text: Click and drag an on-board profile to the Configurations list.

onboardProfiles.reservedSlot: This slot is reserved for Engine. It cannot be directly modified.

deviceConfig.railTooltip: Configurations can be used to quickly switch between different groups of settings for a device. Drag and drop to import or export configurations to a device.
deviceConfig.overwriteConfig: Do you want to overwrite the existing #CONFIG_NAME# configuration?

audioConfiguration.selectPlaybackDevice: Please select your audio playback device that your #DEVICENAME# is connected to.
audioConfiguration.selectMicrophoneDevice: Please select your microphone (line in) that your #DEVICENAME# is connected to.

prismSyncWarning.message1: PrismSync is currently controlling this device.

gamesenseBackground.title: Default Engine App Color
gamesenseBackground.tooltip: This color is displayed on the keyboard when any Engine App is active. This way you have a default color to display for when events aren't occurring.

errors.configNameTaken: This name has already been used. Please choose a unique name.
errors.configNameRequired: You must enter a name for this configuration.
errors.alreadyAutolaunches: The program $1 already autolaunches the configuration $2. A program can only autolaunch with one configuration at a time.
errors.nameTaken: This name has already been used. Please choose a unique name.
errors.invalidCredentials: The email or password you entered is incorrect.
errors.fatalErrorMessage: A fatal error was encountered and has been logged. SteelSeries Engine will now close. If you continue to encounter this error, please file a ticket on our Support Page.
errors.imageError: There is a problem with this image.
errors.tooManyFrames: That animation has too many frames (maximum #MAX_FRAMES#)

led.title: LED
led.disabledIlluminationMessage: Color settings are not available when Disable Illumination is checked.
led.disabledColorForColorShift: Color settings are not available when ColorShift is enabled.
led.disabledInfo: Disable Illumination is selected. Deselect it to view illumination settings.
led.disabledColorForTrigger: Color settings are not available when Trigger is enabled. Switch to steady mode to change color.
led.batteryStatusDescription: Color of selected zone changes according to remaining battery power of Sensei Wireless.
led.disabledColorForBatteryStatus: Color settings are not available when Battery Status is enabled.
led.disabledReasonForRandomizedColor: Color settings are not available when Randomized Color is checked
led.colorShiftModeTooltip: Applies preset gradient across the device instead of a single color.

tooltip.equalizer: Personalize audio frequency response to your preferences. Drag the faders up or down to increase or decrease the amount of each frequency. Presets have been provided to quickly set up your soundcape for different settings.
tooltip.noiseCancellation: Mic Noise Reduction reduces the amount of background noise picked up by the mic and improves the clarity of your voice.
tooltip.dolby:
Turn on Dolby to experience content from games and movies with multi-channel (surround sound) audio streams. For more information on how to configure your soundcard to accept multi-channel audio,

visit our FAQ
tooltip.micVolume: Increase or decrease the volume level of the mic. This provides a convenient way to adjust your mic volume per game or VOIP client without having to go into system settings.
tooltip.sidetone: Mic Sidetone enables you to hear your own voice in your headset. Many people prefer a low level of Sidetone to let them know the mic is working.
tooltip.autoMicGain: Auto Mic Compression automatically keeps the volume level of your voice within game appropriate range so you won't overload your mic or be too quiet for others to hear you.
tooltip.accelDecel: Acceleration and Deceleration modify your mouse cursor speed based on the speed you move your mouse. Within a normal threshold of movement, your mouse cursor will move based on the sensivity you have selected in the CPI widgets. However, if you move your mouse quickly or slowly, you can customize SteelSeries Engine to increase or decrease your CPI.
tooltip.cpi: Sensitivity, or CPI (Counts per Inch) indicates how far your mouse cursor moves in relation to the physical movement of the mouse. Setting a higher CPI value will make the mouse cursor move farther across the screen, requiring less physical movement.
tooltip.cpi2: You can configure two levels of sensitivity for your mouse. Assigned a CPI toggle to a mouse button in Actions menu allows you to change your mouse sensivity on the fly in game with a simple click of a button. Great for sniper mode!
tooltip.pollingrate: Polling Rate determines how often your computer communicates with your device. The values below are measured in Hz. 1000 Hz means that your device's data will be sent to the computer every 1 millisecond. Choosing 125 Hz lowers the frequency to every 8 milliseconds.
tooltip.anglesnapping: Angle Snapping locks in your cursor movement. It analyzes your mouse movement in real time to help straighten out and snap your lines, compensating for human error. Very useful if you want to move your scope to the left and right to pick off enemies as they come over a hill.
tooltip.action: Optimize your gameplay by binding important keys to the buttons on your device. The actions menu allows quick reconfiguration of your layout including keyboard, mouse, media keys, and macros.
tooltip.globalIllumination: Use this widget to make the brightness of all zones on the keyboard the same. If you want to set different brightness levels for each zone, use the color picker to apply darker colors.
tooltip.micAutoOptimization: Mic Auto Optimization automatically keeps the volume level of your voice within game appropriate range so you won't overload your mic or be too quiet for others to hear you.
tooltip.keyboardRegion: Use this widget to change the appearance of the software so that it corresponds with your physical keyboard. If you want to change your keyboard output, adjust your system settings.
tooltip.activeSleepIllum: The selected Active lighting mode will control the keyboard lighting for when the notebook is in use, while the chosen Sleep lighting mode will appear when your computer is asleep.  Adjusting brightness via the Fn+/- hotkeys on the keyboard will not affect the values on-screen or in the saved configuration.
tooltip.streamingOverlay: Switch the streaming overlay ON or OFF. The overlay will not be visible to your streaming application unless it is turned ON.
tooltip.logoPlacement: In case the SteelSeries Logo Watermark obstructs the sensitive area in your game, move it to a different corner or disable it.
tooltip.captureMode: Choose whether to let the overlay assume the resolution of your monitor (when streaming the contents of your desktop) or to bind it to the application specified (when streaming your gameplay). Optionally select to show the bounding box to see the actual size of the overlay in your stream.
tooltip.visualization: Choose how the gaze overlay will appear in your stream. Customize it further by clicking on the color picker hotspot and setting color and opacity to desired values. The final result can be previewed on the left.
tooltip.templates: Templates are lighting patterns that will affect the whole keyboard when applied. They will overwrite any existing illumination effects.
tooltip.lockKeys: Use this to pick the illumination color for active lock keys. Turn this feature off to prevent lock keys from changing color while active. Lock keys include Caps Lock, Scroll Lock, and Num Lock.
tooltip.logoLedToggle: Turn on/off lighting for the logo LED
tooltip.wheelLedToggle: Turn on/off lighting for the wheel LED
tooltip.audioSource: Select the Source that you would like to make active. Sources must be first configured from the transmitter menu before they appear in the list.
tooltip.chatMix:
Note! - ChatMix is only available for Sources with separate game and chat audio inputs.

ChatMix allows you to adjust the balance between the game and chat audio streams. The 12:00 position is full volume of both streams. Rotating towards game reduces the chat volume and vice versa.
tooltip.liveMix:
Note! - LiveMix is only available for Sources with separate game and chat audio inputs.

LiveMix automatically reduces the level of game volume when chat audio is present and returns the game audio to full when chat is silent. Drag the lines up or down to choose the amount (in dB) that the game audio level will reduce when chat is present.

liftDistance.title: Lift Distance
liftDistance.tooltip: Lift Distance determines the distance at which the sensor on the mouse will still register movement when lifted up from from the mousing surface.  A higher lift distance value means that when the mouse is picked up, the mouse will register movement at a farther distance from the surface than it would at a lower value.

batteryPerformance.title: Battery Saver Settings
batteryPerformance.tooltip: Battery Saver Settings control the device's sensor and lights in order to conserve battery life.  Use the presets, or configure your own custom settings.
batteryPerformance.illuminationTooltip: When Smart Mode is on, the logo light turns off when your hand is covering it to save power.
batteryPerformance.sensorTooltip: When Smart Mode is on, the sensor will go into a low-power state to save power when not in use.

keygroup.standardKeyZoneTooltip: This is the group of keys in the central area of the keyboard.
keygroup.functionKeyZoneTooltip: This is the group of keys along the top of the keyboard.
keygroup.numpadKeyZoneTooltip: These are the groups of keys on the right side of the keyboard.
keygroup.macroKeyZoneTooltip: This is the group of keys along the left side of the keyboard.
keygroup.comboKeysTooltip: This is the group of key combinations to which you can bind actions.

m800LayoutChangeWarning.line1: The selected Keyboard Region has a different key layout than the current region. Applying this will cause all unsaved changes to be lost. This change will apply to all existing configs, and may alter some of your bindings or illumination settings.
m800LayoutChangeWarning.line2: Illumination may appear incorrectly if the selected Keyboard Region in the software does not match your physical keyboard.

userImage.imageError: There was an error using this image. Please try again.
userImage.imageTooLarge: The image you are trying to use is too large. The maximum size of a file that can be used is 10MB.
userImage.imageNotSupported: This file type is not supported.

waveMode.title: Wave Mode
waveMode.confirmDialog: Do you want to set the new origin point before exiting Set Origin Mode?
waveMode.dragInstruction: Drag the crosshairs to set the origin.

effectTooltips.steadyColor: When Steady is applied to one or more keys, they will be illuminated with a single color. Use the color picker to the left to choose a color.
effectTooltips.reactiveColor: A key will normally be the rest color, but when pressed will light up with the active color. Click on the swatches next to Rest Color and Active Color to change the colors of the effect.
effectTooltips.colorshift: Add colors to the sequence by clicking near the bottom edge of the gradient. Remove colors by dragging them down. Change colors by clicking on the swatches. Wave Mode will make the colors sweep across the keyboard in waves. When Wave Mode is enabled, click "Set origin" to change the starting point of the wave. Click the thumbnails to change the wave style. Move the wavelength slider to the left to make compact waves and the right to make big waves.
effectTooltips.breathe: Add up to four colors using the editor below. Add colors by clicking near the bottom edge of the gradient. Remove colors by dragging them down. Change colors by clicking on the swatches.
effectTooltips.disable: Disable Illumination turns off illumination on affected keys.
effectTooltips.cooldownTimer:
This feature only works when SteelSeries Engine 3 is running.

NOTE: This feature does not work in Live Preview mode. You must save your configuration to view it.

Cooldown Timer will cause affected keys to change from the Ready Color to the Cooldown Color for the duration of the Timer field value. Use Trigger to initiate this effect on the selected keys when a different key is pressed. Change the Trigger by clicking in the box and then pressing the key on your keyboard that you want to trigger the effect.
effectTooltips.mixed: Two or more keys with different effects are selected. Choosing a new effect from the dropdown will give them all the same effect.

tooManyEffectsWarning.line1: You have reached the limit of ColorShift and Breathe effects for this device.
tooManyEffectsWarning.line2: If you would like to use a new effect, remove one of the existing effects from the keyboard. You can do this by changing keys with a ColorShift or Breathe effect to Steady, Reactive Key, Cooldown Timer, or Disabled.
tooManyEffectsWarning.line3Templates: The template you are applying requires #NUM_TOTAL_EFFECTS# free effects (currently #NUM_FREE_EFFECTS#).

tooltip.deadzone: The deadzone is the area within which the stick will not report any events. In the representation above, the empty area around the stick represents the size of the deadzone relative to the active area.
tooltip.sensitivity:
In the depiction above, blue represents the lowest sensitivity value and red represents the highest. Decrease sensitivity for better control. Increase sensitivity so you can hit the highest value quickly.

Change settings for the X and Y axis at the same time by clicking on the icon to the right of the sliders.
tooltip.maxValue: Max Value can be used to cap the highest sensitivity value reported by the stick. Set values for X and Y axis at the same time by clicking on the icon next to the sliders.
tooltip.invert: Use this to reverse the directions of the stick.
tooltip.linkTriggers: When enabled, this will allow you to adjust the setting of both triggers at once.
tooltip.linkSettings: When enabled, this will allow you to adjust the setting of both sticks at once.
tooltip.trigger: The deadzone is the area within which the trigger will not report any events. The gray area represents the size of the deadzone relative to the active area.

lcd.title: #TITLE# Beállítások
lcd.bestResults: A legjobb eredményért, a kép legyen #WIDTH#px x #HEIGHT#px és fekete-fehér.
lcd.bestResultsWithAnimation: A legjobb eredményért, a kép legyen #WIDTH#px x #HEIGHT#px és fekete-fehér. Az animáció 10 képkocka per másodperccel lesz megjelenítve.

headphonex.tooltip: When enabled, DTS Headphone:X virtual surround sound simulates the 3D environment of your audio's mixing stage. Select the Movie, Music, or Game presets to match your content.

simpleIlluminationWidget.tooltip: Use this widget to choose how the LEDs on the keyboard behave. Select “Steady” if you would like the lights to remain constant. Select “Breathe” if you would like the lights to fade in and out, and then use the slider to choose the rate at which the “breathe” option functions.

tactileCooldowns.title: Tactile Cooldowns
tactileCooldowns.tooltip:
Set up any key on your keyboard or mouse to trigger a custom cooldown timer. At the exact moment your timers finishes, your mouse will provide a tactile alert letting you feel that your ability is now off cooldown.

A Trigger is the mouse or keyboard key that will activate your cooldown timer. Timer Duration is the length of time between pressing the Trigger and receiving your cooldown notification.
tactileCooldowns.placeholderText: Set up any key on your keyboard or mouse to trigger a custom cooldown timer. At the exact moment your timers finishes, your mouse will provide a tactile alert letting you feel that your ability is now off cooldown.
tactileCooldowns.triggerResetsCooldownTooltip: When pressing this button, your created tactile alert will reset to its original duration. If unchecked, your tactile alert will continue counting down even if the button is pressed again.

render.title: Render
render.virtualSurroundTooltip: Emulates a multi-speaker 3D audio environment by taking 7.1 audio and rendering it into a virtualized stream specifically for headsets.
render.bassBoostTooltip: Increases the emphasis on low frequency audio content to the headset speakers.

capture.title: Capture
capture.noiseGateTooltip: Automatically mutes the mic when you are not speaking to suppress background noise.

dynamicRangeCompression.title: Dinamikus tartomány tömörítése
dynamicRangeCompression.tooltip: This feature moderates variations in headphone volume so that all of your audio is delivered at the same discernible level.

multiZone.sweep: Sweep – effect will start in the first zone and end in the second zone.
multiZone.synchronized: Synchronized – effect will play in both zones at the same time.
multiZone.reflected: Reflected – effect will play in both zones at opposite timings.
multiZone.reverseTooltip: Effect motion defaults from left zone to right zone.
multiZone.title: Multizone Illumination Effect

voiceLeveler.title: Voice Leveler
voiceLeveler.tooltip: This feature moderates variations in your speaking volume so that all of your speech is delivered at the same discernible level.

micPreview.title: Live Mic Preview
micPreview.tooltip: Listen to yourself speak live into your own headset to preview your mic settings in action.

effect.title: Effect
effect.tooltip: Pattern the device displays using the LEDs

effectDirection.title: Effect Direction
effectDirection.tooltip: Effect Direction controls the direction in which colors travel in effects with Wave Mode enabled

effectTooltips.steadyColor: When Steady is applied to one or more zones, they will be illuminated with that color. Use the color picker to the left to choose a color.
effectTooltips.colorshift:
With ColorShift, your mousepad will cycle through a series of selected colors. Change colors by clicking on the colored boxes. Add additional colors by clicking near the bottom edge of the gradient, or remove colors by dragging the boxes down.

Wave Mode will make the colors travel across the zones in waves. When Wave Mode is enabled, click "Set origin" to change the starting point of the wave. Click the arrow icons to change the wave style. Move the wavelength slider to the left to make smaller waves and the right to make bigger waves.
effectTooltips.disable: Disable Illumination turns off illumination on affected zones.
effectTooltips.cooldownTimer:
This feature only works when SteelSeries Engine 3 is running.

NOTE: This feature does not work in Live Preview mode. You must save your configuration to view it.

Cooldown Timer will cause affected zones to change from the Ready Color to the Cooldown Color for the duration of the Timer. Change the Trigger by clicking in the box and then pressing the key on your keyboard that you want to trigger the effect.

tooltip.templates: Templates are lighting patterns that will affect the whole mousepad when applied. They will overwrite any existing illumination effects.
tooltip.globalIllumination: Use this widget to adjust the overall brightness of the mousepad. If you want to set different brightness levels for each zone, use the color pickers in Steady or ColorShift to apply darker colors.

pointer.name: Select
pointer.desc: Click the zone(s) you want to edit. Use Shift to add to selection.

dragBox.name: Group Select
dragBox.desc: Drag a box around the zones you want to edit.

magicwand.name: Magic Wand
magicwand.desc: Click on a zone to select all zones that share the same effect.

undo.name: Visszavonás
undo.desc: Undo the last change made in Effect settings.

brush.name: Paintbrush
brush.desc: Paint the current effect settings on other zones.

bucket.name: Paintbucket
bucket.desc: Fill the zones that are touching with the current effect settings.

eraser.name: Eraser
eraser.desc: Remove effect from zone and reset it to the default effect.

eyedropper.name: Effect Picker
eyedropper.desc: Click on a zone to select its effect settings without changing zone selection.

macroEditor.modalText: Are you sure you want to delete macro MACRO_NAME?

limitModals.title: Recording Stopped
limitModals.maxEventsText: Recording automatically stops when the maximum number of events (MAX_EVENTS) is reached.
limitModals.idleTimeText: Recording automatically stops after two minutes of inactivity.

macroEditor.typeInfoKeypress: Create a Keypress Macro to record button presses from your mouse and keyboard. They will simulate button presses when used in a game.
macroEditor.typeInfoText: Text Macros will paste your own scripts or text into a game. They can be used for chat, console commands, or any program where clipboard is enabled.

config.tooltip: Use the dropdown to preview a configuration paired with GameSense effects. This shows how the device will look during a game when this configuration is selected and GameSense is enabled.

singleColor.label: Single Color
singleColor.tooltip: Illumination will be on when the value of the event in game is above 0, and off when it's at 0. When "Display as bar" is enabled, the illuminated area will shrink or grow based on conditions in the game.

kills.tooltip: Illumination will flash once every time you get a kill. At the value specified in the "Flash" field, the illumination will continually flash until the end of the round or match.

dualColor.label: Dual Color
dualColor.tooltip:
Select a color to represent empty (0%) and full (100%) for the selected event. During your game, the illumination will gradually change from one color to the other based on conditions in the game.

When "Display as bar" is selected, the illuminated area will shrink or grow while changing color.

colorRange.label: Color Range
colorRange.tooltip: During your game, illumination will change colors based on current game conditions. When Display as Bar is selected, the illuminated area will shrink or grow as well as change colors.

fancy.label: Special Events
fancy.tooltip: Enable or disable events that have been designed specifically for this game. Special Events are applied to specific keys, and cannot be customized in any way. Affected keys will be locked and cannot be selected.

gameIntegration.overwriteEvent: Adding a new instance of this event will delete the existing one.
gameIntegration.gameDisabled: GameSense has been disabled. Click the toggle below to view illumination settings.
gameIntegration.noConnectedDevices: Plug in a compatible SteelSeries device to use GameSense features.

showAsBar.tooltip:
Apply to three or more keys in a row. As the value for the selected event goes up or down, the illuminated area will shrink or grow just like a classic HP bar.

Keys should be selected in the desired illumination sequence. Relative to the order keys are selected, the last one turns off first. Select keys from left to right for a classic style or right to left for a reverse style.

tactile.label: Tactile
tactile.tooltip: GameSense enables your games to interact with your SteelSeries devices in real time. Configure SteelSeries Engine so that when certain game events are triggered, the device will vibrate. Use unique vibration styles to differentiate between multiple events.

noEvents.line1: Get tactile feedback from your game straight to your #DEVICE#.
noEvents.line2: There aren't any tactile event triggers configured yet.

screen.label: Screen
screen.tooltip: GameSense enables your games to interact with your SteelSeries devices in real time. Configure SteelSeries Engine so that when certain game events are triggered, the information displayed on the device's screen will change. Display game states, custom text and images.

gameIntegration.nameplateTooltip: Set an image that will appear on your device’s screen when GameSense begins running. If any Screen events are set, the nameplate will appear after a Screen Event is triggered and the display queue sequence is complete.

illumination.tooltip: GameSense enables your games to interact with your SteelSeries devices in real time. Configure SteelSeries Engine so that when certain game events are triggered, the illumination on the device will change.

display.label: Display

noEvents.line1: Get feedback from your game to the screen on your #DEVICE#.
noEvents.line2: There aren't any screen event triggers configured yet.

display.clickToAddToQueue: Click to add something to your display queue, so when the event is triggered something will show up on the screen.

gameIntegration.chooseEventToGetStarted: Choose an event to get started.
gameIntegration.nameplateImageWarning: Images should be #HEIGHT#px x #WIDTH#px, less than #MAX_SIZE#, and in black and white.  Animations cannot be used as nameplates.
gameIntegration.allZonesWarning: Unlinking all zones will revert each zone to its default setting.

sensei.onboardProfilesTooltip: The following cannot be exported to a Sensei mouse: Text macros, custom Playback Options, Deploy Configuration bindings, Launch Application bindings, OS Shortcut bindings, Record Macro bindings, and Media Key bindings. Although Keypress Macros can be exported, they will be renamed.
